result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Atty Nelson will not be allowed to withdraw until/unless new counsel retained.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven Lee Forrest in court, in custody from WCJ.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Steven Lee Forrest.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Defendant not eligible for State Public Defender.  Argument on bond; Court sets $1000 cash bond.  Court appoints Atty Gordon Leech.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County pursuant to the terms set forth in 22CF406. Time limits not waived and preliminary hearing scheduled.
